docs.lead_paragraph: The three-time Cy Young Award winner Pedro MartÛnez has extended the opening-day deadline he gave the Boston Red Sox to sign him to a contract extension. MartÛnez said after Monday's opener against the Tampa Bay Devil Rays that talks were continuing, but would not discuss details.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Boston slugger Manny Ramirez is expected to miss at least four to six weeks with a broken left index finger that could require surgery, the Red Sox team physician, Bill Morgan, said today. Ramirez, leading the majors with a .372 batting average, broke the finger Saturday night when he smacked into Seattle catcher Dan Wilson's shin guard on a headfirst slide.
docs.abstract: Boston Red Sox player Manny Ramirez will likely miss four weeks with broken finger suffered after slamming into catcher in headfirst slide (S)

docs.lead_paragraph: Felipe Alou, the former Montreal manager, interviewed for the manager's job with the Boston Red Sox yesterday. Red Sox officials interviewed Grady Little, a Cleveland Indians coach, and Mike Cubbage, Boston's interim manager, on Friday.

headline.main: Red Sox Talk to Alou About Manager's Job

docs.lead_paragraph: Boston Red Sox Manager Joe Kerrigan was fired today by the team's new owners and replaced on an interim basis by the third-base coach, Mike Cubbage. The dismissal was the second big shake-up since John Henry's ownership group bought the team on Feb. 27. A day after the sale, General Manager Dan Duquette was fired and replaced by Mike Port, also on an interim basis.
docs.abstract: Boston Red Sox manager Joe Kerrigan is fired by new owners; along with firing of general manager Dan Duquette, this is second big change since John Henry and partners bought team (M)

headline.main: Kerrigan Dismissed As Red Sox Manager

docs.lead_paragraph: Boston Red Sox shortstop Nomar Garciaparra returned from wrist surgery tonight, and went 0 for 3 for Class AAA Pawtucket in the Red Sox' 11-8 victory over Indianapolis. It was his first game since last September. Garciaparra, hit by a pitch above the hip in the first inning, had been sidelined since surgery on his right wrist on opening day.

headline.main: Red Sox' Garciaparra Returns, Kind Of

docs.lead_paragraph: The Red Sox right-hander Bret Saberhagen has a frayed rotator cuff but said today he would postpone surgery until after the season in the hopes that he could pitch again this year. Saberhagen, 35, is 9-5 with a 3.36 earned run average this season. Saberhagan, a two-time Cy Young award winner with Kansas City, missed most of 1996-97 after unrelated surgery on his right shoulder.
docs.abstract: Boston Red Sox pitcher Bret Saberhagen says he will postpone surgery on his right shoulder until after season (S)

docs.abstract: The similarities between this year’s World Series and the 1975 version have been striking. And in both Series, the Red Sox were on the wrong end of an obstruction decision.

docs.lead_paragraph: The former Red Sox manager Bobby Valentine said David Ortiz spent more time than expected on the disabled list, then returned to it after playing one game.

docs.lead_paragraph: Bobby Valentine, the manager of the Red Sox, agreed with a lot of team’s fans and some of his own players before Saturday’s 4-1 victory against the Yankees: he hasn’t done a great job.
docs.abstract: Boston Red Sox manager Bobby Valentine blames himself for team's struggles, telling reporters that he is unhappy with his performance.
